loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is married and is a mother of 6 children. Her 2 younger children are continuing their education while the remaining had to leave their studies due to financial constraints. They do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family financially.  Her husband is a clothes seller and operates his shop in the market.

Shameem has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With this loan investment he will add a  larger stock and variety of clothes to his shop for the growth of his business.  He has been operating this business for the past many years and Shameem is confident about his business success after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business

loans.name: Grecery

texts.en: Grecery works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Grecery has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. Grecery has been in this business for 10 years now and also earns additional income from food vending. In the future, Grecery would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: 24 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “24 DE MAYO” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes donde la señora Isabel es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: trabajo en fibra de vidrio, hilandería de lana de vicuña, tienda de abarrotes, venta de pan, costura de fundas, tejido de mantas. 
La señora Isabel cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda en general, mismo que trabaja hace varios años.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de arroz, azúcar y aceites) los que comprarán de las ferias tradicionales de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta la capacitación en salud.
En la fotografía no esta presente la señora Isabel pues se encontraba en consultamédica
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo" communal bank is starting its first loan cycle through the Villa Adela regional office. It is made up of six members, and Isabel is the chair. The members of the group carry on various businesses, including fiberglass work, spinning vicuña wool, grocery store, bread sales, sewing bedcovers and weaving shawls. 

Isabel tells us that this is the first time she has belonged to a communal bank within Pro Mujer, and that she was invited to do so by a field worker. Currently, she has a general store business, the same one she has been working in for several years.

The loan she will be getting now is for increasing her working capital through the purchase of  rice, sugar and cooking oil, which she will buy in the traditional markets of El Alto, and then sell at her permanent stand. Working in this way, she helps her family get ahead in life, as she is in a common-law relationship and has two children. 

When we ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health education.

Isabel does not appear in the photo because she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
Mukaram is a hardworking and kind woman. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a pensioner.  

Mukaram has more than 18 years of experience in buying and selling shoes. She started her business in 1995 with the sale of socks. Gradually getting loans from IMON International, she has expanded her business and moved to the selling of shoes. She trades at the central local market. Her loving son is helping her in this business. 

Mukaram would like to get a loan to purchase shoes in order to replenish her inventory.  She looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 49 years old and has 5 children. Dionesia is married and has one child who is in school.

Dionesia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  

Dionesia requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine earns more income from raising pigs and farming rice. Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to buy a vehicle for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Sonia has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more snack foods to sell in her food stall. Sonia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old and is married with one child.  Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running this store for 7 years.  She also earns an income from raising pigs. 

Josephine has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 12 previous loans from NWTF before this loan.  

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Jenlia

texts.en:
Jenlia is married and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jenlia is 31 years old and her four children are all in school.

Jenlia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. Jenlia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to increase the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 72 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Remedios has a retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. Remedios requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
This is Gaudencia. She is 51 and is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, the Philippines. She is married to Jairus, a cook. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.   

Gaudencia operates a street vending business. She sells biscuits, cigarettes, candies, and newspapers. Customers are attracted by her low prices and the variety of products that she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns at least PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000. She will be using the loan to buy more stock and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gaudencia hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of biscuits, candies, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.  Fe has been in this business for 4 years.  She also earns more income from a general store and food vending.

Fe is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.  Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 37 years old and married with 4 children.  Lina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been runnint it for 10 years.  She also earns an income from food vending and dress making.  

Lina has requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan.   Lina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more items such as soap, snack foods and other goods to sell.
Melona has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soap, snack foods and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a school supplies business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending and farming rice.

Tessie requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bags, school supplies, body lotion and clothing.  In the future, Tessie would like to build and expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: buy items to resell

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: Jinky works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years. Jinky has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more items like detergent, soap, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent, soap, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Dalias De Achocalla Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “DALIAS DE ACHOCALLA” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes donde la señora Victoria es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de ropa, cría de animales, venta de salchipapas, tejido de mantas. 
La señora Victoria cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de cría de chanchos, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su abuelita.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de chanchos pequeños) los que comprarán de sus vecinos y posteriormente a la cría lo venderá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es casada.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gustan las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
En la fotografía podemos ver a uno de nuestros Juan Carlo un promotor de nuestra oficina que fue invitado a participar en la fotografía.
texts.en:
The Dalias de Achocalla communal bank is starting its first cycle in the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The communal bank is comprised of nine members, and Victoria is the president.  The businesses that the ladies are engaged in are varied and include: selling food, selling clothes, raising animals, selling “salchipapas” (fried potatoes and fried sausages), and weaving blankets.

Victoria says that this is the first time she has been in a Pro Mujer communal bank.  She was invited by a invitation from a promoter.  She currently has a business raising pigs.  She has been doing this work for several years, and she learned this business from her grandmother.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (to buy piglets).  She will buy the piglets from her neighbors, and after raising them she will sell them at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  This way of working supports her family getting ahead.  She is married.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the training about health and credit.

In the photograph we can see one of the promoters from our office, Juan Carlo.  He was invited to appear in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Corazon De Oro Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “CORAZON DE ORO” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Francisca es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de lubricantes, venta de chapas, venta de salteñas, tejido de mantas, costura de chamarras, venta de café, tejido de chompas, venta y compra de baterías.
La señora Francisca cuenta que hace ocho años que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una familiar; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de lubricantes, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo ya que este es mecánico.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de aceites) los que comprarán de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Corazon de Oro" is starting its first loan cycle in the Villa Tejada central offices of Pro Mujer.  This group has 8 members, and Francisca is the president.  The group has a variety of businesses that they are developing, including: selling lubricants, selling buttons, selling turnovers, weaving blankets, sewing jackets, selling coffee, knitting sweaters, and selling batteries.

Francisca says that she joined her communal bank in Pro Mujer 8 years ago at the invitation of a relative.  She now has a business selling lubricants.  She learned this business from her husband, who is a mechanic, and she's been doing this work for a number of years.  This loan will be used to increase her working capital.  She will purchase motor oils from the distributors, and later sell them from her sales location.  This type of work helps her to support her family; she is married and has 6 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy motor oil

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назира- молодая женщина средних лет. Имеет двоих дочек.Раньше имела торговую точку и торговала на рынке продуктами питания,когда её мужа не было в городе. Он зарабатывает за пределами города и присылает семье деньги каждый месяц.Теперь её муж приехал в отпуск и Назира не может выходить с утра до позднего вечера на рынок, так как это очень ответственная работа.Первые кредиты она использовала на коммерческие цели.Она получала хорошую прибыль работая на рынке и недавно купила себе квартиру.Сейчас Назира работает в частном кондитерском цехе,выпекает печенья и вафели и получает заработную плату но заработная плата уходит только на семейные нужды.
Очередной кредит запрашивает на ремонт сан.узла квартиры, которую купила потому что он в плохом состаянии.Благодарна нам за поддержку,при помощи которой стала владельцем собственной квартиры.
texts.en:
Nazira is a middle-aged woman and has two daughters. Previously, while her husbad was away, she worked as a vendor at an out-of-town market, sending money to her family every month. Currently, her husband is back home on vacation, and Nazira can't work at the market morning til night.

Nazira used her first loans from MDO Arvand, LLC for her business. She made good profits working at the market and has recently bought an apartment. Now she works at a private bakery, making cookies and waffles, but all her salary is spend on her family's needs. Nazira is requesting a loan to repair the bathroom in her new apartment as it is in a very bad shape. She is grateful to MDO Arvand, LLC for their support, thanks to which she became a homeowner.

loans.use: to repair the bathroom in her new apartment

loans.name: Yessenia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña  Yessenia, habitante del municipio de  Nindiri, con mucho esfuerzo labora para una empresa privada, y con ayuda de su  esposo quien la apoya en los gastos del hogar, Yessenia ha recibido nuevamente crédito en Afodenic y está muy contenta por que podrá continuar con la construcción de su casa ya que es su mayor sueño. Con este crédito comprara los siguientes materiales: Boques, Hierro, Cemento, Zinc, Piedrín, Arena, Perlines, Mano de Obra. Ella agradece mucho a Afodenic quien atravez de fon dos Kiva apoya a personas de escasos recursos a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Yessenia lives in the municipality of Nindiri. She works very hard at a private company. She has the help of her husband, who supports her with the household expenses. Yessenia has again received a loan with Afodenic and is very happy because she will be able to continue with the construction of her house, since it is her biggest dream. With this loan she will buy the following materials: blocks, iron, cement, corrugated metal roofing, gravel, sand, purlines, and labor. She is very thankful to Afodenic, who, through funding from Kiva, helps people with scarce resources to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a room

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: La Sra. María de la luz labora vendiendo helados y otros productos congelados por estar en temporada de calor sus ventas se encuentras de maravilla, su esposo el Sr. Gerardo labora como mecánico en un taller de la ciudad los dos viven en casa de la Sr. Irene quien es la madre de la Sra. María de la Luz, por tal motivo desean realizar este proyecto de construcción e instalación de ventanas, pisos al igual que el enjarre  de la casa, construirá un lugar mas amplio para descansar ya que duermen en una recamara muy pequeña.
texts.en:
María de la Luz works selling ice cream and other frozen products. Because it is the hot time of year, her sales are excellent. Her husband Gerardo works as a mechanic in a workshop in the city. 

The two of them live in the home of Irene, who is the mother of María de la Luz. This is why they wish to undertake this project, which involves building and installing windows and floors, as well as plastering the house. She will build a larger sleeping area, as they are sleeping in a very small bedroom.

loans.use: To finish plastering the walls, install flooring, buy and install a door and window, buy materials, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Luis Adrian

texts.es: Luis Adrian es un emprendedor de 37 años de edad,  de la comarca san miguelito, casado con cinco hijos menores de edad tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de ganado desde hace 13 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio de forma ambulante, Luis Adrian inicio dicha actividad con esfuerzo propio y gracias a su tenacidad y responsabilidad ha podido salir adelante en la actualidad cuenta con el apoyo que fundación le ha brindado con los financiamiento para invertir en el negocio como es comprar y vender ganado.
texts.en: Luis Adrian is a 37 year-old entrepreneur from the San Miguelito region.  He is married and has 5 minor children.  He's had a business buying and selling livestock for 13 years, and he carries out this business from place to place.  Luis Adrian started this business with his own effort, and thanks to his tenacity and responsibility, he has been able to get ahead.  He now has the support of the Fundacion, which has provided him with a loan to invest in his business buying and selling cattle.

loans.use: to invest in his business buying and selling cattle

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Elvira has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Elvira has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Merys María

texts.es: Después de unas pequeñas vacaciones en el pueblo donde se encontraba trabajando su compañero, Merys regresó al municipio de Soledad con una nueva idea de negocio que le permite ofrecer nuevos productos a su fiel clientela. Hoy, en compañía de su marido, elabora almuerzos corrientes y a la carta a diario en el pequeño local que posee en su vivienda. Aún produce panes, pudines y galletas y alterna esta actividad con su restaurante con el cual se siente muy motivada y feliz porque su negocio está creciendo y porque ha seguido aprovechando la ubicación estratégica de su local en el transitado sector.  Su anterior crédito lo utilizó en la compra de levadura, harina, huevos, azúcar y demás insumos de panadería, hoy solicita una nueva financiación para comprar al por mayor y de contado las verduras, carnes, víveres, entre las otras cosas que necesita para las comidas que vende; esto le permitiría tener un stock de inventario, obtener descuentos por pronto pago y ofrecer un menú variado a sus clientes que día a día se han ido acostumbrando a su exquisita sazón.  Merys desea que a través de Kiva, muchas personas sigan apoyando a los empresarios para que estos puedan salir adelante con sus proyectos y mejoren sus condiciones de vida y las de su núcleo familiar, mensaje que quiso dejar a sus financiadores.
texts.en:
After a short vacation in the town where her partner was working, Merys returned to the town of Soledad with a new business idea that allows her to offer new products to her loyal customers.  Today, along with her husband, she has a lunch menu and a la carte items every day in the small space she has in her home.  She still makes bread, puddings, and cookies, and alternates this activity with her restaurant, with which she feels very motivated and happy because her business is growing and she has continued to make the most of her strategic location in a busy area.

She used her previous loan to buy yeast, flour, eggs, sugar, and other bakery supplies.  Today she is requesting a new loan to buy, wholesale and in cash, the vegetables, meat, and other supplies she needs to make the dishes she sells.  This would allow her to have a stock of inventory, get discounts for quick payment, and offer a varied menu to her customers who have become accustomed to her delicious flavors every day.

Merys hopes that through Kiva many people will continue support the entrepreneurs so they can get ahead with their projects and improve their living conditions and those of their nuclear family: a message she wanted to give her lenders.

loans.use: to buy, wholesale and in cash, vegetables, supplies, and meat.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es: Diana invirtió su anterior crédito financiado por Kiva en la compra de leche en polvo, aceite, arroz, mantequilla, harina, bebidas entre otros, al por mayor para la venta tanto en el municipio de Soledad como en Barranquilla.  Al principio le fue muy bien, con su capital viajaba periódicamente a Maicao a realizar sus compras de productos provenientes del país vecino Venezuela, se incrementaron sus ventas y pudo ofrecer nuevos productos, sin embargo, a finales del año anterior se le presentaron algunos inconvenientes ya que por seguridad y otras restricciones, la guardia fronteriza no dejaba circular ningún tipo de mercancía a los comerciantes, lo que ocasionaba pérdida de tiempo y dinero, sus ventas se vieron afectadas y para hacer frente a este desafío decidió no viajar más sino vender mercancía por encargo como bermudas, suéteres, shorts, jeans y electrodomésticos menores como televisores y lavadoras que compra acá mismo en la ciudad y que vende a crédito principalmente. Esto ha tenido mucha acogida entre sus clientes y le ha ido tan bien que desea comprar con su nuevo crédito mayor volumen de mercancía para atender la demanda.  Le da gracias a Kiva ya que le han dado la oportunidad de engrandecer el negocio y espera seguir contando con ese gran apoyo.
texts.en: Diana invested her previous Kiva loan in the wholesale purchase of powdered milk, cooking oil, rice, butter, flour, drinks and other items to sell in the municipalities of Soledad and Barranquilla.  At first it went very well.  With her capital, she was traveling periodically to Maicao to purchase products that come from neighboring Venezuela.  She increased her sales and was able to offer new products.  However, at the end of last year, she was presented with some problems because due to security and other restrictions, the border guards were not letting any type of merchandise through to the retailers.  This caused her to lose time and money, and her sales were affected.  To cope with this challenge, she decided not to travel anymore.  Instead, she sells merchandise based on customer orders, such as bermuda shorts, sweaters, shorts, jeans, and domestic appliances such as TVs and washers, that she buys right here in her city, and she sells mainly on credit.  This business has been well-accepted by her customers, and it has been going so well for her that she wants to buy a greater volume of merchandise with this loan so that she can meet the demand.  She gives thanks to Kiva, because Kiva has given her the opportunity to expand her business, and she hopes to be able to continue to rely on this great support.

loans.use: To buy clothing and household appliances to sell

loans.name: Higinio

texts.es:
Higinio, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como el abono e insecticidas, que son materiales muy necesario para que él pueda iniciar la siembra de granos básicos, él considera que este préstamo será de mucha ayuda ya que estos materiales serán financiados gracias a este préstamo.
El efecto que tuvo el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que logró obtener lo necesario en la siembra de maíz, maicillo y frijol, estos préstamos le han facilitado los recursos económicos y ha podido tener una producción mayor libre de plagas y con oportunidad de comercializarla.
texts.en:
Higinio is requesting a new loan, in order to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides, which are very necessary materials for him to begin planting staple grains. 

He considers that this loan will greatly help him, as these materials will be paid for thanks to this loan. 

The previous loan had a positive effect, as he managed to obtain what he needed for growing corn, sorghum and beans. These loans have provided him with financial resources, and he has been able to have greater production, free of pests, that he has the opportunity to sell.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Karina Isabel

texts.es: Con su primer financiamiento, la joven comerciante Karina, compró mercancía como ropa, calzado, víveres, rancho, perfumería, productos de papelería y electrodomésticos menores para surtir su negocio de miscelánea y variedades que posee en el municipio de Soledad.  Como era su objetivo, con ello logró ganar descuentos por pronto pago y volúmen y mayor rentabilidad con sus ventas.  Actualmente, por la temporada en la que se encuentran los negocios por la celebración del mes del padre, solicita un nuevo financiamiento que le permita atender los pedidos de sus clientes principalmente en lo que tiene que ver con prendas y accesorios masculinos como bermudas, pantalones, calzado, billeteras, perfumes, entre otros artículos en general.  Karina desea que su negocio crezca y se fortalezca, es por esto que cada día se esmera en conocer más el gusto de su clientela y se enfoca en satisfacerlo.  Hoy envía un mensaje a sus financiadores de kiva asi: “Les estoy muy agradecida por el préstamo que me hicieron y ojalá me sigan apoyando para aumentar mi negocio.”
texts.en:
With her first loan Karina, a young businesswoman, bought merchandise like clothes, shoes, supplies, ready to eat meals, perfume, paper products, and small electrical appliances.  She did this in order to stock the miscellaneous and variety business that she has in the Soledad municipality.

As it was her objective, she managed to get discounts for buying in volume and paying quickly.  This made her sales more profitable.  

Currently, businesses find themselves in the month for celebrating fathers.  She is requesting a new loan that will allow her to take care of her customers’ orders.  These are mostly for men’s garments and accessories like Bermuda’s, pants, shoes, wallets, perfume, and other general items.

Karina wants to strengthen and grow her business.  That is why she tries very hard every day to better know her customers’ preferences and focus on satisfying them.

Today she sends a message to her Kiva lenders, “I am very grateful to you for the loan you gave me.  I hope that you will continue supporting me in order to increase my business.”

loans.use: to buy Bermuda’s, pants, shoes, wallets, perfume, and other general items.

loans.name: Maritza Felicita

texts.es: Maritza tiene 58 años. Soltera con tres hijos mayores  tiene por actividad económica es la venta de repuestos usados. El cual cuenta con una experiencia de 19 años Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio pues han sido de gran ayuda. Este crédito es para la compra de llantas, repuestos  usados para vehículos,  herramientas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 58, is single and has three adult children.  Her business activity is selling used replacement parts.  She has 19 years of experience in the business.  

This is not the first loan she has had for her business, and they have been a big help.

This loan is to buy tires, used replacement parts for vehicles, and tools, among other things.

loans.use: to buy tires, used replacement parts for vehicles, and tools, among other things.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque está iniciando una nueva siembra en una manzana de terreno, para esto deberá comprarse los materiales como el abono y los insecticidas, que le ayudan a proteger los cultivos de las enfermedades como las plagas, éste será una gran ayuda para José ya que contará con los recursos necesarios para poder tener una cosecha abundante.
Gracias al crédito anterior logró comprar todos los insumos agrícolas que le han ayudado a poder tener una mejor producción y a mejorar los ingresos económicos, ya que logró comercializar parte de la cosecha, en su vida familiar también han mejorado las condiciones ya que ha tenido tanto el alimento como ingresos económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
José is seeking a new loan because he is starting to plant crops on a plot of land approximately 1.5 acres in size.  For this he needs materials such as fertilizer and insecticides.  These things will help to protect his crops from infestations of insects and will help him to have an abundant harvest.

Thanks to his previous loan he managed to buy all the agricultural supplies he needed in order to improve his crop production and increase his income. He managed to sell part of his harvest and keep the rest for his family.  Things have improved in his family life now that he has sufficient food as well as income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies so that she can maintain her pineapple crops

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia Maria sigue pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq en la provincia del Cusco y departamento del Cusco.

La socia Maria continua dedicandose a la venta de joyas como aretes,pulseras,anillos entre otros,la socia elabora estas joyas conjuntamente con su pareja,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de sus aretes como alambre.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria continues to be a member of the “IMASUMAC II” communal bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Maria continues to dedicate herself to selling jewelry such as earrings, bracelets and rings, among others. She makes these jewelry items together with her husband. She has years of experience with this business, which is going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work every day. She is a responsible and hard-working person with a great desire to keep working for her family. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy supplies, such as wire, to make her earrings. 

The borrower is grateful to the support which will be provided to her, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as wire, to make her earrings.

loans.name: Jorge Alexander

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hija en una colonia suburbana de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Hace diez años que Jorge estableció su propio taller de sastrería en su casa, donde confecciona trajes de vestir, pantalones y reparación de cualquier prenda de vestir. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos. El solicita 10,000.00 Lempiras, este es el tercer préstamo.  El cual lo va invertir en la compra de materiales de costura como ser: telas, hilos, agujas, botones, etc. para confeccionar trajes de vestir y reparación de todo tipo de ropa. Este préstamo le ayudara mucho a incrementar inventario ya que necesita confeccionar uniformes de estudiantes y tener siempre en existencia para vender.  Su meta es mantener activo el negocio y que le genere buenos ingresos para ayudar a su hija con los estudios y también lograr ubicar un local en el mercado local para que el negocio sea mejor.
texts.en:
Jorge is 38 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and daughter in a suburban neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Ten years ago Jorge established his own tailor shop in his house.  He makes suits and pants, and he repairs clothing.  This business is his only source of income.

This is his third loan, and he is requesting 10,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy sewing materials like fabric, thread, needles, and buttons, etc.   He will use these items to make suits and to repair all types of clothes.

This loan will be a big help to increase his inventory.  He needs to make student uniforms, and he needs to always have them to available to sell.

His goal is to keep his business active and to generate good income in order to help with his daughter’s education.  He also wants to manage to have a location in the local market in order for his business to be better.

loans.use: to buy fabric and all types of materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr: Marthe est une jeune camerounaise âgée de 25 ans, célibataire et mère de d'un enfant. elle a en plus de son enfant 04 autres sous sa reponsabilité. elle un salon de coiffure dans un marché de la ville depuis 05 ans dans lequel elle vend aussi les produits de beauté. elle s'approvisionne sur place et elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter les greffes et mèches pour les proposer à sa clientèle qui achète jusqu'à présent ailleurs. les revenus supplémentaires générés seront d'une part réinvestis dans son activité sous forme de report à nouveau afin d'augmenter son capital et d'autre part alloués à l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Marthe is a young, 25-year-old, Cameroonian lady.  She is single and the mother of one child.  In addition to her own child, she has four others in her care.  She has run a hairdressing salon in one of the town markets for 5 years where she also sells beauty products.  She buys her supplies locally and would like to use this loan to buy hair extensions and hair weaves to sell to her customers who, up to now, have bought these products elsewhere.  She will re-invest some of the extra income she makes in her business so that she can increase her capital.  She will use the rest to cover her children's education.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair weaves

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara forma parte del Banco Comunal “Emprendedores del Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de abarrotes en su almacén que lo ubica en su propia casa. Se desempeña en este negocio desde hace 2 meses, comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 8ºº hasta las 22ºº horas.
Comenta que sus insumos los compra directamente en bodegas, distribuidoras y supermercados, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará aceite, azúcar, leche, bebidas para abastecer su negocio.
Una de sus metas son instalar una maquina de vitrina en su almacén para que sus clientelas vean los productos que tiene para ofrecer y vender, además agregar venta de otras provisiones, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Sara vive junto a su marido, y 2 hijos, donde uno de ellos es discapacitado, y el otro hijo trabaja de guardia, comenta que se siente muy feliz al tener buenos hijos ya que son ellos la que la impulsan a seguir surgiendo en la vida. Sus sueños son poder comprar la maquina que le falta en su almacén para aumentar sus ventas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras el grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respeto a las capacitaciones impartidas en la reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the "Emprendedores del Futuro" ("Entrepreneurs of the Future") communal bank in the city of San Fernando.

She sells groceries in her store, which is located in her own house. She started this business 2 months ago. She tells us she works every day from 8 am until 10 pm.

She says she buys her supplies directly from warehouses, distributors, and supermarkets, since these are places in which she finds her merchandise at low cost, which is economically advantageous.

With the loan she will buy oil, sugar, milk, and beverages to stock her business.

One of her goals is to install a glass case in her store so that her customers see the products that she has for sale, and to add other items for sale, and in this way aim for a better quality of life.

Sara lives with her husband and 2 sons, one of whom is disabled. The other son works as a guard. She says she feels very happy having good sons, since it is they who push her to continue moving forward in life. Her dream is to be able to buy the case for her store in order to increase her sales.

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her, since it has allowed her to invest in her business. Also, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank, since they share different activities and interests, which has also served as a moment of diversion for her. With respect to the trainings given at the meetings, she has learned to manage her business in a better way.

San Fernando is a city located in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region, in the central part of Chile. The city's economic activity is principally based on agriculture (vineyards, beet, fruit, tobacco and wheat cultivation, and traditional farming), agroindustry (fruit export businesses, canneries, milk producers, etc.) and trade.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, milk, and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: San Pedro De Huatajata Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “SAN PEDRO DE HUATAJATA” inicia su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes donde la señora Gaby es la Tesorera.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de pescado, compra y venta de carne, venta de queso, transportista, venta de charque o pescado. 
La señora Gaby cuenta que hace medio año que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por la promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, mismo que trabaja hace varios años, aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su negocio (compra de charque) los que comprarán de las ferias comunales y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante pues ella es soltera.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The "San Pedro de Huatajata" communal bank is starting its second loan cycle through the Copacabana regional office. It is made up of ten members and Gaby is the treasurer. 

The group members carry on a variety of businesses, including selling vegetables, selling fish, buying and selling meat, selling cheese, hauling, and selling jerky. 

Gaby tells us that she has belonged to a communal bank in Pro Mujer for a half a year, and that she was invited to do this by the field worker. 

Currently she has a business selling vegetables, that she has been working in for several years, having learned it from her family. 

The loan she will be getting now is to diversify her business through the purchase of jerky, which she will buy at the local markets, and then sell at her stall. 

Working in this way will help her keep going, as she is single. 

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes saving money.

loans.use: To buy jerky.

loans.name: Erika Patricia

texts.es: Erika es una cartagenera de 26 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de frutas, tubérculos,  productos de pancoger y al hidrolavado de motocicletas y taxis en un lugar arrendado en la avenida principal del Barrio Olaya Herrera de su ciudad natal.  Con su credikiva solicitado, desea  adquirir canastas para la exhibición de las frutas y una mesa de mayor tamaño y más presentable a la que tiene para organizar mejor el negocio, además de ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece en este momento.  Erika empezó a trabajar desde muy joven atendiendo el negocio de tienda que posee su madre, pero cuando formó su propio hogar con su compañero permanente y su pequeña hija, decidió independizarse llevando consigo su gran visión de comerciante y motivada por un hermano que le consiguió el terreno donde se encuentra  el negocio actualmente.  Allí empezó a vender sólo frutas pero luego su padre, quien tomó la administración del negocio debido a que ella consiguió un empleo como contratista y aprovechando los conocimientos que tiene como carnicero,  incluyó dentro de la actividad la venta de carnes.  Así, con el tiempo el negocio se fue fortaleciendo y ganando cada vez más clientes.  Pero esto no fue suficiente para Erika, al ver que el lugar donde está ubicada es muy estratégico, decidió sacar provecho de eso y compró una bomba hidráulica con la cual empezó a ofrecer allí el servicio de lavado de vehículos  lo que hasta el momento ha tenido muy buena acogida y se han logrado muy buenos resultados.  Erika cuenta con la colaboración de su familia para la atención de su negocio,  es por esto que su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo y llegar a tener una gran tienda donde le pueda dar cabida a todos y con el que obtenga mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de los suyos.
texts.en:
Erika is 26-year-old Cartagena resident who works selling fruit, tubers, and vegetables, and pressure washing motorcycles and taxis in a rented space on the main avenue of the Olaya Herrera neighborhood of her native city. With the loan she is requesting, she hopes to better organize her business by buying baskets for displaying her fruits and a larger, more presentable table than the one she has. She also wants to increase the variety of the products she offers at this time.

Erika began working at the shop her mother owned when she was very young; when she established her own household with her life partner and little daughter, she decided to strike out on her own, armed with her great business sense and motivated by a brother who got her the space where her business is currently located. There she started out selling fruit; later, her father (who had taken on running the business because she had gotten a job as a contractor) took advantage of the knowledge he had as a butcher and added the sale of meats to the business. So, with time, the business continued becoming stronger and attracting more customers all the time. But that was not enough for Erika; recognizing that her business was very strategically located, she decided to take advantage of that. She purchased a hydraulic pump and began offering a vehicle washing service, which has been very well received and successful so far. 

Erika has her family's help in staffing her business; for that reason, her biggest dream is to continue growing and eventually have a large store that can accommodate everyone and earn greater profits to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy baskets and a table to display the fruits and tubers that she sells, and to expand their variety.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo con la intención de surtir el negocio, comprándose una variedad de jugos, agua en bolsa, gaseosas, boquitas, producto de aseo personal, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para que Víctor pueda levantar nuevamente el negocio y mantener los productos de mayor demanda.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudó a mantener surtido el negocio, en su momento las ventas fueron abundantes de las cuales lograba sacar para el pago de los gastos del hogar, pero creía necesario en esta fecha volver a invertir para no descuidar ese del buen servicio los clientes.
texts.en:
Víctor is seeking a new loan with the intention of supplying his business.  He will buy a variety of snacks, juices, bottled water, sodas, and personal hygiene products.  This will be of great benefit as he will be able to expand his business and keep himself stocked with products that are in high demand.

He reports that his previous loan helped him to maintain his inventory in this way.  His sales have been very good, and because of this he has been able to cover his household expenses.  However, he believes it is now necessary to invest in his business again and make sure to keep offering this high level of service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy snacks, juices, bottled water, sodas, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita forma parte del Banco Comunal “Emprendedores del Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando.
Margarita se dedica al rubro de vendedor ambulante de frutas y verduras, desde hace 12 años, se desempeña en sus labores de vendedora de lunes a domingo desde las 9ºº hasta las 19ºº horas.
Su mercadería la compra en lo Valledor (cuidad ubicada en Santiago) ya que es un centro de distribución de frutas y verduras donde sus precios son a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará una potranca (yegua de menos de cuatro años de edad) y frutas, verduras frescas para abastecer su negocio.
Una  de las metas de Margarita son agregar más productos para la venta como carne, leche, jaleas, aceites gran surtido de comestibles para captar más clientela.
Margarita vive junto a sus 3 hijos de 21, 13 y 1 año de edad. Su sueño es adquirir otra camioneta para generar más ventas y ganancias, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
Margarita belongs to the Emprendedores del Futuro communal bank, which is in the city of San Fernando.

She has been selling fruit and vegetables in an itinerant manner for 12 years.  She works as a salesperson from Mondays through Sundays from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She buys her merchandise in Valledor (a city in Santiago).  She buys there because it is a distribution center for fruits and vegetables where prices are below cost, and, therefore, financially good.

She will use the loan to buy a filly (a mare less than four years old), and fresh fruit and vegetables to stock her business.

One of Margarita’s goals is to add more products to sell like meat, milk, jelly, and cooking oil.  She wants to have a great stock of food in order to win over more customers.

Margarita lives with her three children, ages 21, 13, and 1.  Her dream is to get another truck in order to generate more sales and income.  This way she would have a better quality of life.

She is very grateful and happy about the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza.  It has allowed her to invest in her business.  Also, she says that she feels very comfortable with the meetings and her communal bank because they are generous and united.  

San Fernando is a city which is located in Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region, in the central area of Chile. The city's economic activity is based mainly on agriculture (vineyards; beet, fruit, tobacco and wheat growing; and traditional agriculture), agroindustry (fruit exporting companies, canning companies, dairy companies, etc.) and trade.

loans.use: to buy a filly (a mare less than four years old), and fresh fruit and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Un ambiente familiar, fresco, cómodo y limpio, un rotulo donde ofrece el menú del día a sus clientes, asi es el negocio de Francisco un humilde habitante de Granada, de 44 años de edad,  dueño de un kiosco muy similar a su personalidad alegre, creativo, sencillo pero con muy buena atención a sus cliente es como trata de mantener su negocio Francisco, donde ofrece el platillo típico de la ciudad de Granada como es el vigoron también vende hamburguesas y bebidas variadas, en su actividad cuenta con 25 años de experiencia y total dominio, casado, padre de 3 hijos mayores de edad de vida independiente. El inicio su actividad trabajando con una pequeña caseta en la venta de vigoron luego fue invirtiendo en hamburguesas y hot dog por que sus clientes solicitaban otro tipo de platillos, el vio que el negocio era bueno pues le generaba mas ganancias y busco el  apoyo de otras instituciones financieras para invertir más en su kiosco y satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposa y paga mano de obra, sus productos los comercializa en un local situado en Granada, su expectativa es mejorar cada día en su kiosco, mantener el negocio con buena presentación pero sobre todo mantener siempre sus productos para complacer a los clientes.

Solicita el cerdito para comprar productos como yuca, repollo, zanahoria, chicharrón  y mejorar el área del local para poder elaborar sus ricos platillos, el estima  que el crédito ayudara ya que podra mejorar la infraestructura del negocio haciéndolo mas atractivo para los visitantes extranjeros que pasan por el kiosco de Francisco disgustando sus deliciosos platillos. Sus planes futuros es crecer en su negocio tanto en productos como en infraestructura para ofrecerles una mejor comodidad a sus clientes y poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en: A family environment - fresh, clean and comfortable, with a sign that shows the menu of the day to his customers - this is Francisco's business. He is a humble 44-year-old resident of Granada. He owns a kiosk that is very similar to his personality - creative and simple but very attentive to his customers. These are the qualities he tries to maintain in his business. He offers dishes typical of the city of Granada, such as vigoron, which consists of pickled cabbage, tomatoes and onions with yucca and fried pork skins. He also sells hamburgers and a variety of drinks. He has 25 years of experience in the business and has mastered all of its aspects. He is married and is the father of three adult children who now live independently. He started out with a small cart from which he sold vigoron. Later he invested in hamburgers and hot dogs since his customers wanted other types of dishes. He saw that the business was going well and looked for support from other financial institutions to invest more in his kiosk and satisfy the demands of his customers. His wife supports him in his business, and he also has other workers on his payroll. He sells his products in a location in Granada. His expectation is to improve his kiosk every day, ensure that his business makes a good impression, and above all to always ensure the quality of his products in order to please his customers. He is seeking this loan to buy products such as yucca, cabbage, carrots and pork, and also to make improvements to his food kiosk. This will allow him to make his tasty dishes. He believes that the loan will enable him to improve the infrastructure of his business and make it more attractive to foreign tourists that stop by his kiosk and enjoy his delicious food. His plan for the future is to grow his business in terms of infrastructure and product offerings to make it more comfortable for his customers. This will allow him to offer a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy products such as yucca, cabbage, carrots and pork, and also to make improvements to his food kiosk.

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo pues inicia la siembra de la temporada de invierno, ella se encuentra queriendo preparar los terrenos y para esto necesitará el dinero e invertirlo en la compra de abono, insecticida, pesticidas, que le permitirá proteger la siembra de las plagas.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le dio lo necesario para seguir trabajando en agricultura, esto también le permitió poder recibir una buena cosecha de la cual logró comercializar y generar ganancias para su familia.
texts.en: Ana is requesting a new loan because it's the beginning of the winter sowing season. She currently wants to prepare the land and for that she will need money. She will invest it in the purchase of fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide, which will allow her to protect the crop from pests. She believes that the previous loan provided her with what she needed in order to continue her agricultural work. It also allowed her to get a good crop, which was successfully sold and resulted in income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ceviche que es un plato a base de pescado con limon acompañado de camote,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salira adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ceviche.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar el ceviche.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues with her business selling ceviche, which is a dish based on fish with lemon, accompanied by camote (sweet potato). She is a street vender, working from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m. Through this business she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand and improve her business selling ceviche.  This member is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make ceviche.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare ceviche.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel forma parte del Banco comunal “Emprendedores del Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa y servicios de fotocopiadora, también cuenta con otros implementos como juegos de niños de camas elásticas, donde las usa más en la temporada de verano, desde hace 6 años se dedica a estos rubros, comenta que trabaja sola y que a veces ofrece su mercadería en ropa a su clientela de casa en casa, trabaja todos los días y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, supermercados y distribuidoras de insumos de computación a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará materiales, tinta, toner, ropa de mujer y niño para la temporada de invierno.
Sus metas son continuar con el negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así
Con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Isabel vive junto a su esposo. Sus sueños son expandir su negocio agregando otros implementos como una impresora multifuncional.
Isabel está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad 
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Community Bank, "Emprendedores del Futuro" (Entrepreneurs of the Future), which belongs to the city of San Fernando. She makes a living selling clothing, operating a small photocopy business, and selling other items, such as kids' games for trampolines, which are most popular in the summer. She began her business over 6 years ago, and she works alone, sometimes traveling from house to house selling clothing. She works every day, and can create her own daily schedule.

She purchases her merchandise from distributors and supermarkets in the city of Santiago for relatively low prices, which is helpful for resale purposes. With the support from this loan, she plans to purchase materials, ink and toner for her photocopy machine, as well as winter clothing for women and children. Her goal is to continue with her business and generate more profits, hopefully leading to an improved quality of life.

Isabel lives with her husband, and her dream is to expand her businesses and add more machines, such as multifunction printers, to her copying business. She is very grateful for the support she has received from Fondo Esperanza, and she is happy with the environment at the Community Bank, as it is one of generosity and unity.

The city of San Fernando is located in the Liberator General Bernardo O'Higgins region, which is in the central zone of Chile. The main economic activity of the city is based on agriculture (vineyards, radishes, fruits, tobacco, wheat and traditional crops), agro-industry (exporting companies for fruits, canning factories, dairy processing plants, etc), and trade.

loans.use: to purchase materials, ink, toner, and winter clothing for women and children.

loans.name: Greisy Estela

texts.es: Greisy de 29 años, casada y madre de 3 hijos, reside en el barrio San Fernando de la ciudad de Cartagena y se dedica desde hace 3 años a ofrecer servicios de nivelación académica. Para ello utiliza dos escenarios como lo son la vivienda donde reside y las de señoras de estratos 2, 3 y 4 que la contratan para que a domicilio enseñe, dirija tareas escolares y refuerce lo aprendido en las escuelas de sus hijos.  Se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para solicitar su primer credikiva con el fin de adquirir un computador ya que para el área de las matemáticas se hace necesario un software que le permita desarrollar actividades a través de juegos lúdicos e interactivos. Greisy, al igual que el conocido filósofo, está convencida de que “el hombre no es más que lo que la educación hace de él”, siempre se ha preocupado por enseñar a los niños con calidad para así lograr buenos resultados en el futuro y en su aprendizaje, es por esto también que desea terminar su carrera para lograr una nivelación superior con la que pueda desempeñarse además como docente en una escuela, de tiempo completo.  También quiere tener su  casa propia para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Greisy is 29 years old, and is married with three children.  She lives in the neighborhood of San Fernando in the city of Cartagena, and for the past three years she has offered academic tutoring.  She teaches out of her home, and also teaches in the homes of students of low socioeconomic status.  She helps them with their school homework and helps to reinforce what the children are learning in school.  She has approached the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, seeking her first Kiva loan in order to purchase a computer.  For teaching mathematics, she needs to use software that will allow her to develop educational activities that are engaging and interactive.

Greisy, like the well-known philosopher Immanuel Kant, is convinced that "a man is merely what education makes of him."  She has always been concerned about teaching children well so that they will be able to continue to learn and be successful in the future.  It is for this reason that she wishes to change careers and attain a higher level of education so that she can work as a full-time school teacher.  She also wants to have her own home so that she can provide a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a computer to use as a tool for teaching mathematics to children, to whom she offers tutoring services.

loans.name: Paola Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Paola tiene 24 años, es soltera, ella se dedica a la confección de balones de futbol, su taller se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Paola va a usar este préstamo para compra de cuero para la confección de balones por cantidad ya que tiene muchos pedidos, ella entrega a distintos mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo, Paola enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de material para seguir incrementado su producción y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Paola is 24 and single. She makes soccer balls. Her shop is located in her home. This is her first loan with Emprender. 

Paola is going to use this loan to purchase leather to make balls in volume since she has many orders, which she delivers to different markets in the city of Cochabamba. She confronts many challenges in her business, such as competition. Her reason for requesting this loan is to gain an advantage by buying material to continue increasing production.  In this way she will increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather to make soccer balls.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de refrescos, él quiere seguir brindando el servicio a los clientes con una calidad para mantener su preferencia, se comprará gaseosas, jugos y agua en bolsa, que son los más necesarios en el negocio.
El manifiesta que con el credito anterior logró incrementar el inventario de mercadería atendiendo de una mejor manera la demanda de los clientes, esto mismo le ha permitido tener una mayor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan for investing in his refreshment business. He wants to keep on providing quality service for his customers, in order to maintain their preference. He will purchase soft drinks, juice and bags of water, the items he most needs in his business.
He expresses that with the previous loan he successfully stocked up on merchandise and better met his customers' orders. This has allowed him and his family to become more financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, juice and bags of water.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy works hard to support her family. Amy is single and has a sari-sari store in the Philippines.

Amy requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, cooking oil, and other groceries to sell.

Amy has been in this business for 20 years now, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Amy would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items like soft drinks, bread, cooking oil, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store where she sells a variety of items such as sardines, sugar, milk, spices, etc. She has been in business for four years.

Erlinda has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Isroil

texts.en: Isroil began a livestock business 20 years ago. He cares for his livestock very well, and in this way, Isroil develops his business year by year. He sells meat and milk to the local people. Isroil’s products ensure meals for his fellow citizens. He has a wife and two children. His income doesn’t fully cover his modern life. That’s why he also works as a driver. Isroil tries to do the best for his family’s comfort. His aim is to buy corrugated asbestos boards for repairing his house.

loans.use: To buy corrugated asbestos boards

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Emprendedores del Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la ganadería, desde hace 7 años, comenta que trabaja sola en su casa todos los días, además vende productos de maquillaje por catálogos. Ella ofrece sus productos y sus clientes llegan a su domicilio comprar.
Comenta que sus insumos los compra en las ferias de la ciudad de San Fernando, ya que le venden a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará terneros, pollos, conejos, patos gallinas para abastecer su ganadería.
Una de las metas de Sonia son comprar un vehículo, específicamente una camioneta para transportar su mercadería y comprar con más facilidad sus animales, ya que ella misma los llevaría.
Sonia vive junto a su marido. Sus sueños son seguir creciendo con su ganadería y a la vez adquirir más animales, así con optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
Sonia is part of the communal bank “Emprendedores del Futuro” in the city of San Fernando.  For seven years she has been in the business of raising livestock.  She reports that she works on her own at home every day, and she also sells cosmetic products from catalogues.  Her clients come to her home to buy these products.  She buys these items in the markets of her city, since they are sold there at low cost.

With the loan funds she will buy turtles, chickens, rabbits, ducks and hens to add to her livestock.  One of her goals is to buy a vehicle, specifically a pickup truck to transport her merchandise and animals more easily, since she has to transport them herself.  

She lives with her husband.  Her dream is to keep growing her livestock business and acquire more animals, with the aim of having a better quality of life. She is very happy and grateful for this opportunity brought to her by Fondo Esperanza, since this has permitted her to invest in her business.  Further, she is very comfortable being in the company of the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank.  They all have different business activities and interests, and this makes things more interesting.  Thanks to the training sessions that have taken place at the meetings, she has learned how to run her business more effectively.

San Fernando is a city located in the region Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgin in the central area of Chile.  The economic activity of the city is based primarily on agriculture (vineyards, fruit trees, beets, wheat, tobacco and traditional crops), agroindustry (export of fruits, preserved goods, dairy products, etc.), and other commerce.

loans.use: to buy turtles, chickens, rabbits, ducks and hens to add to her livestock.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la venta y reparación de bicicletas, pues quiere comprarse repuestos no hemos para poder tener a disponibilidad del cliente su inversión será en pedales, Catarina, maniubros, frenos, cadenas, ya que esto le permitirá atender siempre bien a su clientela.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con un préstamo anterior ya que le permitió realizar una buena inversión y poder tener mejores ventas, este crédito le mejoró también su estabilidad económica familiar.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan for repairing and selling bicycles, because she wants to purchase spare parts in order to have them available to her customers. She will invest in pedals, sprocket wheels, handlebars, brakes and seats, and this will allow her to always serve her customers well.
She got a positive result from her previous loan, since she was able to put it to good use and make better sales. The loan also improved her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase pedals, sprocket wheels, handlebars, brakes and seats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide.

loans.name: Milagro Isabel

texts.es:
Milagro, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el cultivo de pipián y maíz, pues para esto deberá comprarse los insumos necesarios como el abono, herbicidas, y foliares, que son los que le ayuda a prevenir las plagas durante el desarrollo del cultivo.
Ella Se decidió por este préstamo debido al efecto que tuvo con el anterior, pues le ayudó a mejorar la cosecha y a obtener una buena producción, su condición una familia ha mejorado ya que dependen de la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Milagro is requesting a new loan to invest in the cultivation of squash and corn. She needs to purchase the necessary supplies such as compost, herbicides and foliar fertilizers, which help her prevent pest infestations during crop development. 

She decided on this loan because of the result she had with the previous one, which helped her to improve her harvest and obtain a good yield. The conditions of her family have improved, since they depend on agricultural production.

loans.use: to purchase compost, herbicides and foliar fertilizers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and married with two children. Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marites has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s sanitary supply business.

With the loan investment, he will buy sanitary supplies such as pipes, taps, etc. in larger quantities. This will allow him to fulfill larger orders on time and increase his profits.

He has been operating his business for many years and is a very experienced person now. Allah Rakhi is hopeful that he will get further established in his business by using this loan.

Allah Rakhi is a housewife. She remains at home and does her household responsibilities.

She has given birth to six children and takes care of them very well. Her two elder sons work and contribute to the family financially.

She is very positive in her thinking and hopeful about her family’s future.

loans.use: To buy taps and pipes for her husband's sanitary supply business

loans.name: Jordan David

texts.es:
Jordan es un joven de 21 años de edad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que tiene un clima muy cálido y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, pallares, paprika, entre otros, se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, la cual es  muy visitada en todo el año por infinidad de turistas. Cuando Jordan tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio, ya que se distrae mucho y sobre todo pasa un momento divertido y agradable, en ocasiones también le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Sus padres afortunadamente pudieron brindarle una buena educación y por ello el logro estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica.

Con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo Jordan trabaja como mecánico de conversión de vehículos de gasolineros a gas, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas diarias, en un trabajo un poco tedioso sobre todo porque tiene que tener mucho cuidado en la instalación; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque lo hace con mucha responsabilidad.

Jordan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas como destornilladores, gata, alicates, así como equipos para la instalación de los tanques de gas en los vehículos, así el podrá realizar mejor sus labores y poder realizar un mejor trabajo, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un auto”.
texts.en:
Jordan, 21, lives in Ica, a city that has a warm climate and many agricultural products such as grapes, asparagus, butter beans, peppers, etc.  These are found in the Huacachina lagoon which is visited by many tourists all year long.  When Jordan has some free time, he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends from his neighborhood.  That is a good distraction and he spends a fun and agreeable time.  He also likes to eat one of this favorite dishes, the delicious “Aji de Gallina” (traditional chicken stew).  Luckily for him his parents could give him a good education and so he was able to study mechanical engineering.

Jordan works with a lot of enthusiasm and effort as a mechanic who converts gas-powered vehicles to those using natural gas.  He works about 9 hours a day.  It’s a little tedious, especially because he has to be very careful with the installation.  He believes that he’s doing well in his work because he is very responsible.

Jordan is very grateful for the Kiva loans since thanks to them he could buy tools such as screwdrivers, wrenches, pliers, as well as equipment to install gas tanks in vehicles.  In this way he can improve his work and do a better job and it allows him to keep trying every day to succeed with his big dream, “to have his own house and a car”.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Elsa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz en semilla para sembrar abonos, herbicida, rastreo de la tierra, todo esto le permite iniciar su trabajo de una mejor manera, con la esperanza de que su producción sea abundante y sana.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le mejoró la productividad ya que obtuvo una buena cosecha dándole una mayor posibilidad para vender y de esta manera también tener ingresos a su familia
texts.en:
Elsa is requesting a new loan in order to buy corn seeds for planting, compost, and herbicides. She will also pay to have the land plowed. All of these expenses will enable her to start working with better conditions in hopes of having an abundant and fruitful harvest.
