This is Rowena, 39, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Luisito, an OFW, and mother to their three children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Rowena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighbourhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rowena hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa, se formo a partir del contacto con una de las miembros quien al enterarse del programa invito a sus vecinas muchas de ellas comerciantes a formar parte del grupo. Ellas trabajan unidas y se ayudan en todo lo que pueden para de esa forma mejorar sus vidas.
Mirna es la presidenta del grupo, y comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, y demás tipos de productos. Mirna cuenta que en todo lo que hace siempre trata de motivar a sus amigas para seguir dentro del grupo, el cual les es de mucha ayuda.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de sabanas, frazadas y demás productos para venderlos, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The 'Kuña Guapa' committee was formed when one of its members found out about the program and invited her neighbors (many of whom are saleswomen) to join the group.  The ladies work together and help each other as much as they can so that they can improve their lives.

Mirna is the group's president and she says that she sells all kinds of products, including sheets and blankets, as an itinerant vendor.  Mirna says that she is always trying to motivate her friends to remain within the group as it is very helpful.  She is requesting this loan to buy sheets, blankets and other products to sell.  This will enable her to continue growing as a micro-businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Ehouédé Émilienne

texts.fr: Ehouédé Émilienne est âgée de 23 ans et est mariée à un certain Sylvestre. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ehouédé Émilienne a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Ehouédé Émilienne vit avec ses enfants. Ehouédé Émilienne vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les diverses charges familiales. Depuis sept ans, Ehouédé Émilienne mène comme activité la vente de poissons dans sa région. Par contre Ehouédé Émilienne achète ses produits dans une autre région du Bénin. C’est la cinquième fois que Ehouédé Émilienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, crédit qui lui servira à élever le niveau de son activité et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Ehouédé Émilienne is 23 years old and married to a man named Sylvestre. They have two children, both in school and in their care. Ehouédé Émilienne dropped out of secondary school. She lives with her children. She helps out her husband in covering the diverse household expenses. 

For seven years, she has been selling fish in her region. But she purchases her products from another region of Benin. 

This is the fifth time that Ehouédé Émilienne has requested a loan from ALIDé. It will serve to boost her business and to satisfy her customers further. The previous loans have indeed been paid back.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo está integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que vieron una gran oportunidad, no solo para ellas sino también para sus familias.
Adolfina es una de las miembros de este grupo, y ella nos comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y mejorando su negocio de venta de zapatos. Ella es una persona que tiene muy buena onda a la hora de hacer sus ventas, es por ello que tiene ya una clientela bien definida. Su meta es poder tener una gran zapatería y de esa forma ir creciendo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados, para hombres y mujeres, y de esa forma estar siempre con mucha variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Coronel Oviedo, is comprised of 20 women who are all friends and neighbors of this city. They saw a great opportunity, not only for themselves, but also for their families.

Adolfina is one of the group's members. She tells us that with sacrifice and effort, she has been growing and improving her shoe sales business. She is a person with a great spirit when she does her job, and therefore she has a well-defined customer base. Her goal is to be able to have a large shoe store and, in this way, to continue growing. She is requesting this loan to buy men's and women's shoes. This way, she will always have a large variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes

loans.name: Ysapy Group

texts.es:
4 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso se unieron con la esperanza de poder crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por sus hijos, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Gladys es parte del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo que ella misma prepara. Comenta que tiene una buena clientela, ya que tiene muy buena sazón.  Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne, condimento, verduras y demás productos para poder seguir ofreciendo alimentos frescos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fourteen women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together in the hope of making progress not only from a financial point of view but also from a personal point of view.  They are all heads of household who work hard for their children so that they can give them everything they need in order to live a life without hardship.

Gladys is a member of this group and she tells us that her business is selling all kinds of food that she prepares herself.  She says that she has a good customer base because the food she prepares is very tasty.  She is requesting this loan to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables and other products so that she can continue offering fresh food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables and other food products

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario  tiene 56 años y es soltera, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, fideo, arroz y azúcar, su tienda se encuentran ubicado en la zona Libertad, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosario  va a usar este préstamo de para compra de abarrotes por mayor como fideo, arroz y azúcar y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir ampliando su  negocio, la Sra.  Rosario va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una amplia gama de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Rosario is 56 years old and single.  Her business is selling basic household products such as groceries, noodles, rice and sugar.  Her store is located in Libertad district.  This loan is her second one from the institution.  Rosario will use her loan to buy groceries such as noodles, rice and sugar wholesale so that she can increase her working capital.  She is requesting this loan so that she can continue expanding her business.  Rosario will use the profits to continue buying merchandise and thereby continue improving her income.  Her wish for her business is to have a wide range of basic household products in stock.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
This is Joey, he previously availed a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain his jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help in the education of his child and in his personal household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a PHP15,000 loan in order to buy spare parts and to maintain his jeepney unit as well as to buy some equipment in the repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Joey dreams to be able to buy another jeepney. He also dreams that his child will finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from his study of the Word of God.*

Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines to throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and they modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain a jeepney.

loans.name: Badriddin

texts.en:
Badriddin is a hardworking man who is married and has five children. The children are still small. The eldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 8 months. 

Badriddin goes to Russia to work each year in the season. Arriving home in the off-season, he deals with cattle breeding and agriculture. He mainly grows wheat, potatoes and other agricultural products. For over eight years he has been in this business. His caring wife helps him in business. The resulting crops he sells to local citizens. 

He would like to get a loan for purchasing mineral fertilizers and he also wants to buy cattle in order to increase the number of livestock.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and cattle.

loans.name: Suisala

texts.en:
Suisala is 29 years old and married. She has four children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as packs of chicken, mutton flaps, sausages, sack of sugar, etc. She has been doing this for two years.  

Suisala needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, soft drinks, snacks, sugar, rice and noodles. She hopes to use her profits to expand her shop. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase box of chicken, soft drinks, snacks, sugar, rice and noodles.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a 26-year-old married woman with six children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Amelia has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, gloves and a wheelbarrow for her garden.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Amelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for vegetable seeds, gloves and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Elise Marie Chantal

texts.fr: Elise marie Chantal est âgée de 47 ans et est marié à un certain Florent. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Elise marie Chantal a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Elise marie Chantal vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les diverses charges familiales. Depuis neuf ans, Elise marie Chantal mène comme activité la vente d tissus et des cartes de recharge par le système de distribution. Elise marie Chantal s’approvisionne au Togo. C’est la deuxième fois que Elise marie Chantal sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Elise marie Chantal est âgée de 47 ans et est marié à un certain Florent. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Elise marie Chantal a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Elise marie Chantal vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les diverses charges familiales. Depuis neuf ans, Elise marie Chantal mène comme activité la vente d tissus et des cartes de recharge par le système de distribution. Elise marie Chantal s’approvisionne au Togo. C’est la deuxième fois que Elise marie Chantal sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des cartes de recharges.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Santa Librada actualmente se encuentra en el 3° ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres. Ellas son reconocidas en su comunidad por la forma en que trabajan, ya que siempre lo hacen unidas y se ayudan las unas a las otras para que gracias a su trabajo puedan dar a sus familias lo que necesitan.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señorita  Rossana, soltera de 26 años  quien desde muy jovencita se dedica al macate (Venta ambulante) y de esa forma saca adelante a su madre, ya que ellas viven solas y la misma es el sostén de la casa.
Rossana solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, edredones y demás productos para poder tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y de esa forma hacer un poco de ganancias.
texts.en:
This group, called “Santa Librada,” is currently in its 3rd loan cycle with the “Comite de Mujeres” [Women's Committee] program. They are recognized in their community for the manner in which they work, always in a united fashion, with one helping the other, so that, thanks to their work, they are able to provide their families with the necessities.

A story worth relating is Rossana's; she is single, 26 years old, and has, since she was very young, been dedicated to selling things in the streets. In this way, she has been able to advance her mother. They live alone and Rossana sustains their household.

Rossana is requesting a loan to buy sheets, blankets, eiderdowns, and other products, to be able to offer a greater variety to her customers and, in this way, to produce some earnings.

loans.use: buy sheets, blankets, eiderdowns, and other products to sell in the streets.

loans.name: Tuipine

texts.en:
Tuipine is a 24-year-old woman who is married with two children. 

She runs a business making elei (hand-painted fabric for dresses) in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Tuipine has requested a loan to buy more materials, paints, brushes and some new patterns for the elei. 

She plans to use her profits to put up her own elei shop in the village. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase paints, brushes and materials.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.fr:
Vedaste est né au Rwanda et a 26 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfant de 2 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 2 ans de secondaire.
Vedaste est salarie. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 45 pièces des tôles, 2 portes métalliques, 5 fenêtres, 30 arbres de charpente, 12 kgs des clous pour réhabiliter sa maison. 
 
Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait construire des maisons pour la location.
texts.en:
Vedaste was born in Rwanda and is 26 years old. He is married and has a 2-year-old child. Vedaste has two years of middle school education, and he is salaried. 

This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 45 each of sheet metal, 2 metal doors, 5 windows, 30 trees for lumber, and 12 kg of nails for renovating his house. 

In the next few years, Vedaste would like to build houses to rent out.

loans.use: to buy 45 each of sheet metal, 2 metal doors, 5 windows, 30 trees for lumber, and 12 kg of nails for renovating his house

loans.name: Emprendedoras Unidas Group

texts.es:
l Comité Emprendedoras Unidas actualmente se encuentra en el ciclo numero 14, son integrantes de mujeres sacrificadas y emprendedoras, todas se dedican en sus respectivas actividades y mediante su trabajo ayudan a sus familias.
La Sra. Gabina es una de las integrantes que se siente beneficiada con el programa de la fundación, ella es muy activa, se siente  motivada por el deseo de salir adelante, se dedica exclusivamente a la venta de remedios refrescantes en el mercado de la localidad. Destacamos las ganas  e iniciativa de la Sra. Gabina en progresar con la oportunidad brindada por la Fundación Paraguaya.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios refrescantes (Hierbas naturales) con las cuales podrá seguir trabajando y así tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Comité Emprendedoras Unidas (United Women Entrepreneurs Committee) is currently working their 14th cycle. Its members are resourceful and self-sacrificing women who engage in their own activities to help their families through their jobs.
Gabina is one of the group members who feels benefitted by the Fundación’s program. She is a very active woman motivated by her desire to get ahead in life. She engages completely in the sale of herbal remedies in the market of her community. We would like to call attention to Gabina’s initiative and her desire to progress thanks to the chance she has been given by Fundación Paraguaya.
She is requesting a loan to buy herbal remedies (natural herbs) thanks to which she will carry on with her activity in order to earn an income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy herbal remedies to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano, es de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, el principal objetivo de estas 19 señoras es superar la pobreza en las que están viviendo, ellas y sus familias, para ello están trabajando arduamente y demostrando que juntas y unidas se puede conseguir el éxito.
Crisolina es la presidenta y miembro del grupo, quien tiene un pequeño copetín donde vende alimentos, bebidas, golosinas y demás. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, y gracias a su sacrificio y trabajo diario ha podido ir creciendo y mejorando. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de golosinas, y bebidas, para poder surtir su negocio y seguir de esa forma trabajando.
texts.en:
The committee San Cayetano is in the city Caaguazú and the primary goal of these 19 women is to overcome the poverty that they live in, both the women and their families. To do this, they are working hard and proving that together and united they can achieve their goal. 
Crisolina is the president, and a member of the group, and she has a small snack shop where she sells foods, drinks, candies and more. She says that she began with a small business and thanks to sacrifice and daily hard work she has been able to grow her business and continue to improve it. She is asking for a loan to purchase candies and drinks in order to stock her business and be able to continue to work in this line of work.

loans.use: purchase candies and drinks for re-sale.

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s livestock business. With the loan investment he will buy a buffalo for selling for profit. He will also sell its milk to his community clients to earn extra income.

Rasheedan's husband is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years.

Rasheedan is confident that her family business will grow after the investment of the loan and will bring positive changes to her family’s life.

Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rasheedan."

loans.use: to buy buffalo for livestock business.

loans.name: Dwi Rahayu 2 Group

texts.en: The Dwi Rahayu 2 group was formed by nine women who have similar purposes and businesses as pig breeders. They got the information about pig breeding from the other group in their village, Dwi Rahayu 1. Actually, they already have pigs at home, but they want to improve their businesses by joining MUK. Ni Wayan, head of the group, has three children and they all are still in school. Her husband works as a farmer who planted banana, coconut, cacao and other items. Ni Wayan will use the loan to purchase superior piglets. Now the price is 450,000 IDR per piglet. Ni Wayan has a big dream of becoming a succesful pig breeder so she can help her husband with their family's living costs.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар- молодой парень,образованный бухгалтер, работает в транспортно-экспедиторской компании.Женат, имеет небольшую семью из пяти человек.Так как его дети все взрослые и за ними не нужен особенный уход,жена тоже вышла на работу.Она торгует на базаре женской обувью.Молодая семья живет отдельно от родителей и работают вместе чтобы улучшить свои жизненные условия.У отца Анвара в селе есть мини-ферма и там каждый сын помогая родителям держит свой скот.У Анвара также там есть свой вклад и на накопленные деньги он покупает скот и увеличивает поголовье.Обычно кредиты он использует на покупку скота,но очередной кредит просит на потребительские цели.Так как его квартира нуждается в обновлении он хочет освежить квартиру и сделать небольшой ремонт.
texts.en: Anvar is a young fellow, with a degree in accounting. He works for a logistics company. He is married and has a small 5-head family. Since his children are big and don’t need special care, his wife has gone back to work too. She sells women’s shoes at the marketplace. The young family lives separately from their parents and work together to improve their living condition. Anvar’s  father has a small farm in the village, and each of the sons in the family keeps his livestock there, to help out parents. Anvar has also invested in the farm and uses his savings to buy livestock and expand the farm. He usually requests loan to buy livestock, but the current loan is for personal use. Since his apartment needs to be spruced up, he would like to make some improvements and small renovation works.

loans.use: to renovate his apartment.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro tiene 43 años de edad, está en pareja hace ya unos años. El señor Walter es sastre, se dedica a este trabajo desde hace más de quince años y actualmente tiene mucha clientela ya que es muy conocido, también tiene clientes de la ciudad de Posadas.
El trabaja sobre pedidos, también posee stock de prendas. Gracias a esta actividad él ha salido adelante, su negocio ha ido creciendo de a poco y mediante esto puede mantener su hogar y educar a sus hijos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, con lo cual podrá cumplir unos pedidos que tiene, ya que no quiere hacer esperar a sus clientes. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de seguir trabajando y progresando.
texts.en: Mister Pedro is 43 years old and has been in a committed relationship for several years. Mr. Walter is a tailor and has been in this line of work for more than 15 years and currently has a large clientele because he is well known.  He also has clients in the city Posadas. He works on orders placed and also has a stock of garments. Thanks to this activity he has moved forward, his business has grown little by little and he is able to maintain his home and educate his children. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase fabric, with which he will be able to finish orders that have been placed and he does not want to make his customers wait. He is a responsible person with a desire to continue working and progressing.

loans.use: purchase fabric.

loans.name: Aaster's Group

texts.en:
Aaster is married and operates a livestock business with her husband. They grows goats and sheep and sell them to butchers. They also sell buffalo milk to their community clients for reasonable rates.

Aaster has given birth to 5 children. All of them are enrolled in local school and are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her family business.

With the loan investment her husband will purchase goats, sheep in larger number and will sell to butchers by growing them up.

Aaster is confident that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her family business and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy animals for livestock business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbage, tomato, and other vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Rosalina needs a loan to purchase cabbage, tomato, and cucumber seeds, gloves, a rake, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Rosalina will use the profits from her sales to improve her home and help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage, tomato, and cucumber seeds, gloves, a rake, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Faalagi

texts.en: Faalagi is a 30-year-old woman who is married and has two children. She operates a barber shop. She has one year of experience with this business. Faalagi needs a loan to purchase scissors, combs, mirrors, hair shampoo, and hair dryers for her business. She will use her profits to expand her business. Faalagi joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase scissors, combs, mirrors, hair shampoo, and hair dryers

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Actualmente  el comité San Cayetano se encuentra en la etapa 10º ciclo con 10 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan unida gracias a que se conocen muy bien por los ciclos que han estado juntas. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con un gran espíritu de superación, por lo que siempre se esfuerzan para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Francisca, quien se dedica a la venta de chipas (Alimento típico paraguayo) nos comenta que gracias a su trabajo en el comité ha podido mejorar mucho, y de esa forma tiene mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus familiares. Ella es una mujer sacrificada y con grandes esperanzas de tener un mejor futuro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas, las cuales venderá y eso le ayudará a seguir trabajando y dando a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día.
texts.en:
The Comité San Cayetano (Saint Cajetan Committee) is currently working their 10th cycle. It is composed of 10 members who work closely together, having come to know each other very well through their cooperation in the previous cycles. They are very hard-working women with a strong desire to improve in life, and for this reason they always do their best to mutually help each other.
Francisca engages in selling “chipas” (a typical Paraguayan dish), and she has told us that thanks to his job in the committee she has succeeded in improving a lot in her activity, and that she has consequently increase her income and has been able to help her family. She is a self-sacrificing woman who deeply hopes to have a better future.
She is requesting a loan to buy chipas to sell: this will allow her to carry on with her activity, thus succeeding in providing her family with their daily necessities.

loans.use: To buy chipas to sell.

loans.name: Tirupi

texts.en: Faaiuga is 33 years old, married and the mother of five children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by owning and operating a small store where she where sells items people use every day. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, including noodles, toilet paper, rice, sugar, chicken, sausage, snacks, soft drinks and beer. She hopes to use the additional profits she earns to expand business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital that would help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Bedmie

texts.en: Bedmie is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines with his wife and child. For the last three years, he has earned a living by providing motorela or motorcycle services. He is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline. He joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve his services and help support a child he and his wife will have soon.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María es viuda, tiene tres hijos dos son menores y uno ya es  mayor y trabaja de forma independiente. Ella es costurera tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas.
María estudio corte y confección cuando aún vivía con sus padres. Y comenta que su hijo mayor le ayudo con su trabajo a comprar sus maquinas, ella también trabajaba con una amiga y así junto un poco de dinero para ayudar a su hijo a montar su pequeño taller. Hoy día ella es una profesional en su trabajo trabaja con cortinados sabanas y manteles de mesa. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en sus compromisos, y con unas grandes ganas de salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra telas de variados tipos, también de cierres, gomas y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
María is a widow.  She has three children.  Two of her children are still young but the eldest is an adult and works independently.  María is a seamstress and has a small dressmaking workshop in her home where she works every day from very early in the morning. 

María studied dressmaking when she still lived with her parents.  She says that her eldest son worked to help her buy her sewing machines.  María also used to work with a friend and managed to put together a little money to help her son set up her small workshop.  Now María is a professional and works making drapes, sheets and tablecloths.  She has shown herself to be a very responsible person as regards her commitments.  She has a great desire to do well in life.

María is requesting a loan to buy different types of fabric.  She will also buy fasteners, adhesive and other supplies that she needs in order to be able to continue working.  She is grateful for the help that she is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fasteners, adhesive and other supplies

loans.name: Sinei

texts.en: Sinei is a 53-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, ufi, etc., to earn a living. Sinei has requested a loan to purchase a wheelbarrow, plant sprayer, spade, rake, and bush knife to start her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Sinei will spend her profits to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a wheelbarrow, plant sprayer, spade, rake, and bush knife

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la mejora de su negocio, se comprará productos como gaseosas, jugos, también algunas prendas de vestir como camisas y blusas, esto le servirá para fortalecer el negocio y seguir ofreciendo productos de calidad.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo y una gran experiencia crediticia que le han servido para mejorar y poder manejar mejor el negocio, actualmente se encuentra iniciando la construcción de su vivienda y espera que el crecimiento del negocio le ayude para poder terminar esta construcción.
texts.en:
Ángel is requesting a new loan to invest in the improvement of her business. She will buy products such as sodas and juices, but she will also acquire a few articles of clothing, such as shirts and blouses. This will strengthen her business and enable her to continue offering quality products.

The effect of her previous loan was positive. Having a good credit experience allowed her to improve her business and do a better job of managing it. At the moment, she has started the construction of her home and hopes to grow her business in order to help with the completion.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, and a few articles of clothing.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen  tiene 24 años y es soltera con un hijo que tiene la edad de 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta de Ropa de segunda mano, tiene su puesto de venta en una zona muy popular de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carmen  va a usar este préstamo para  Capital de trabajo (compra de ropa de invierno) para surtir su negocio. Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es  Aumentar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Carmen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo ir ahorrando ya que su deseo es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Carmen is 24 years old. She is single, with one child who is two years old. She works selling secondhand clothing. She has her sales stand in a very popular area of the city of Santa Cruz. This loan represents her fourth cycle with the institution. Carmen will use this loan for working capital, buying winter clothing to stock her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her working capital. Carmen faces challenges in her business such as competition, and she will use the benefits to keep increasing her working capital and continue saving up, because her desire is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock canned goods, soap, shampoo, and beverages

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 19 years old and married. For the last two years, she has earned a living by owning and operating a small store where she sells items people use every day. She is requesting this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, including chicken, sausage, sugar, salt, flour, noodles, snacks and soft drinks. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business, and became a member of SPBD earlier this year to gain access to capital to use to improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Violeta

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 31 años, soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  6 y 13 años, la Sra. María  se dedica a la venta de bisutería y demás accesorios para mujeres, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona La Ramada, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo para compra de mercadería variedad de bisutería para surtir su puesto de venta,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de ampliar  y satisfacer a su clientela ofreciendo variedad de productos en su negocio, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old, single, and has two children who are 6 and 13 years old.  Her business is selling jewelry and other ladies' accessories.  She sells these products from her sales location in La Ramada district.  This is her first loan from the institution.

María will use her loan to buy a variety of jewelry with which to stock her sales location.  She is requesting this loan because she needs to expand her business and satisfy her customers by offering a good variety of products.  María faces challenges in her business such as the need to increase her customer base. She will use her profits to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jewelry

loans.name: Dwi Rahayu 1 Group

texts.en: This is the Dwi Rahayu 1 loan group, which is made up of women who earn a living by raising pigs. They formed their group to get funding and training from MUK. Ni Made, who leads the group, is married and has one child who is in elementary school. She plans to use her portion of this loan to buy four pigs that she will spend five months fattening. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy pig feed. Her main expenses are for food, electricity and water.  Although her business is still small, Ni Made hopes that it will allow her to support her child's education and pay for books and other items needed for school.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que iniciará para la temporada de invierno su trabajo en la siembra de maíz y frijol, comprándose abono, herbicidas, y semilla, para poder trabajar en las condiciones necesarias y aplicar los materiales al cultivo que le ayuden a prevenir las plagas.
El considera que con la compra de insumos a través de los préstamos el ha estado mejorando su producción agrícola, esta es la razón por la que él se ha decidido a continuar trabajando con la institución, pues considera que también su familia se ha visto beneficiada con el alimento.
texts.en:
Santiago is requesting a new loan as he is about to start sowing his winter corn and beans.  He will buy fertilizer, herbicides and seeds so that he can work in the right conditions and apply these materials to his crops so that he can prevent pests.

Santiago believes that buying his supplies through loans has helped him to improve his yields.  This is why he has decided to continue working with the institution.  He believes that his family have also benefited from the food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en: Saima is married and operates a business selling clothes. She has a good variety of clothes available for her clients, which helps her make more sales and profits every month. Her husband operates a motorcycle workshop. He also sells new and used motorbikes to his clients for reasonable rates. Saima has given birth to a daughter and two sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy a motorcycle to sell for profit. He is experienced in his business, and Saima is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for him. Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book, Asasah Passbook, is Saima.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for a motorcycle-sales and repair business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.fr:
Jean Paul est né au Rwanda et a 23 ans, il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Jean Paul est agriculteur. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences des pommes de terre et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des pommes de terre, il planifie de moderniser son agriculture en utilisant les fumiers industriel et des fertilisants moderne. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans son région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de continuer ses études.
texts.en:
Jean Paul was born in Rwanda and is 23 years old; he is unmarried. His level of education is 6 years of secondary school.

Jean Paul is a farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy potato seeds and pay for manual labor.

To grow his potato farming, he plans to modernize his farming by using industrial fertilizers and modern fertilizers. In the coming years, he would like to be a great farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans to continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Ahad

texts.ru: Ахад-семейный мужчина,занимается частными работами.Он мастер на все руки.Ахад- сварщик, садовник,повар по заказу,электрик...У него большая семья, два сына с собственными  семьями и детьми.Старшие сыновья работают за пределами города постоянно присылают родителям деньги на питание.Он владеет несколькими ремёслами и постоянно по сезону работает и копит свои деньги, экономит и содержит свою семью.Его дети порекомендовали Ахаду получить кредит на покупку автомашины и сами будут погашать кредит каждый месяц.Он хочет купить себе автомашину, чтобы быстрее добраться до рабочего места и просто катать своих близких по необходимости.
texts.en:
Ahad is a family man. He is a self-employed jack-of-all-trades: Ahad can work as a welder, gardener, cook, electrician... He has a large family, and two of his sons have their own families and children. His oldest sons work outside of town and periodically send their parents money for food. Since Ahad is a master of several crafts, his work is seasonal. He saves his money and lives frugally to support his family.

Ahad's children suggested that he purchase a car by taking out a loan, which they will repay themselves each month. Ahad would like to buy a vehicle so that he can travel to his work sites more easily, and also take his family for rides.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle

loans.name: Liduvin Maira

texts.es: Liduvin Maira casada, con 40 años de edad , dos tres hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería , la cual inicio como herramienta de trabajo para ser independiente económicamente y satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos, y aportar económicamente a la casa, tiene cinco años de experiencia la cual ha demostrado destreza con los financiamientos, en esa  ocasión  el financiamiento lo solicita para la compra de  productos de consumo diario del hogar como: arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, pan, tiste, frijoles, fosforo, verduras, frutas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Liduvin Maira is married, 40 years old, and has three minor children. Her business is a convenience store, which she started as a means of becoming financially independent, providing for her children, and contributing financially to her home. 
She has five years of experience, during which she has shown her skill in handling financing.
This time she is requesting financing in order to purchase staple products for the home, such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, tiste (a drink made of corn and cocoa), beans, matches, vegetables, fruit, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase staple products for the home, such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, tiste, beans, matches, vegetables, fruit, and other items.

loans.name: Médéssè Catherine

texts.fr: Médéssè Catherine est agée de 33 ans et est mariée à un électricien du nom de Epiphane. Médéssè Catherine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Médéssè Catherine vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les diverses charges familiales. Depuis dix ans environs, Médéssè Catherine mène comme activité la vente de poissons dans sa région. Par contre Médéssè Catherine achète ses produits dans une autre région du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Médéssè Catherine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, crédit qui lui servira à élever le niveau de son activité et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Médéssè Catherine is 33 years old and is married to an electrician named Epiphane. Médéssè Catherine did not go to school. The couple has three children, all in school and under their care. Médéssè Catherine helps her husband by taking care of the diverse family responsibilities together with him. 

For about 10 years, Médéssè Catherine has been selling fish in her region. On the other hand Médéssè Catherine buys her products in another region of Bénin. This is the fourth time that Médéssè Catherine is requesting a loan from ALIDé, a loan that will help her to raise the level of her business and better satisfy her clientèle. The previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 36 años, es soltera, pero tiene tres hijos, junto a ellos, vive en una casa que heredó de sus padres, y se ubicada en el distrito de Perené (selva central).

Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años en las parcelas que compró fruto de su trabajo y ahorros. En todo este tiempo aprendió a producir café y plátano, los que al cosechar, negocia en la ciudad de Santa Ana (a 20 minutos de su localidad). “Tengo tres parcelas, este mes estoy cosechando una, las otras dos recién están sembradas”, menciona. Ahora tiene pensado preparar nuevas plantitas de café para sembrarlas en otras dos parcelas que arrendará. Así también, tiene un motocarro, con el que su hijo mayor realiza servicio de transporte, aportando otros ingresos para la familia. Esther confía que con su nueva producción podrá tener mejores ingresos, para ello cuenta con el apoyo de sus tres hijos.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por eso agradece el apoyo brindado en todo este tiempo. Menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará 18 bolsas de fertilizantes y abono orgánicos. Cada uno le cuesta alrededor de 200 soles. Con ellos podrá iniciar el embolso de las plantitas de café que sembrará.
texts.en:
Esther is 36 years old, single, and has three children. They live together in a house that she inherited from her parents. Esther resides in the central jungle in the District of Perené.

She has been a farmer for 20 years and has parcels of land that she bought through hard work and with savings. Throughout this entire time, Esther learned how to produce coffee and bananas. Once harvested, she trades her products in the city of Santa Ana, which is 20 minutes away from her town. "I have three parcels of land. This month, I'm harvesting on one of them and the other two were recently planted," mentions Esther. Now she is planning to prepare new coffee seedlings for planting on two other parcels of land that she is renting. Esther also owns a motorcycle taxi that her oldest son drives in order to provide transportation services and generate additional income for her family. She is confident that her new crop will result in more income that she can use to support her three children.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is grateful for the support she has received this entire time. Esther says that she will be punctual with her monthly loan payments. The money from this loan will be used to buy 18 bags of fertilizer and organic compost. Each one costs around 200 PEN. This will enable her to start sectioning out the coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy 18 bags of fertilizer and organic compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, soap, shampoo, detergents, and beverages

loans.name: Grâce Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GRÂCE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Anne Marie est celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo. Anne Marie est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un électricien du nom de Théodore. Anne Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple a deux autres enfants à charge en dehors de leurs enfants. Anne Marie et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de dix ans, Anne Marie vend divers articles et de l’huile végétale à son domicile. Anne Marie s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Anne Marie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GRÂCE, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
The GRÂCE group is made up of three friends who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the second time that the group is seeking financial aid from ALIDé, in order to expand its business. 

The group's representative, Anne Marie, is the woman who is raising her hand in the photo. Anne Marie is 44 years old and married to an electrician named Théodore. Anne Marie did not attend school. The couple has three children, all of whom have had schooling and live in their care. In addition to their own children, the couple has two other children living in their care. Anne Marie and her husband cover the various family expenses together. 

For almost two years now, Anne Marie has been selling various items and vegetable oil from her home. Anne Marie stocks up in her region. Striving to satisfy her customers and increase her revenue, Anne Marie, along with the other members of the GRÂCE group, is seeking another loan.

loans.use: to buy various items and cans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio, con el objetivo de utilizar estos recursos para el crecimiento y la superación en el comercio, se comprará ropa nueva, sandalias para damas y niñas, también un surtido de artesanías como collares aretes pulseras, esperando tener un buen resultado de esta inversión.
El efecto que ha tenido con el préstamo anterior le ha generado mejores ganancias, pues sus ventas le han aumentado, además considera que estos beneficios han llegado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan so that he can invest his business. His goal is to utilize his resources so that he can grow and excel in this trade. José will buy new clothes, sandals for women and girls, and also restock on handicrafts such as necklaces, earrings, and bracelets. He hopes to have good results with this investment.

The effect of his previous loan resulted in more earnings due to an increase in sales. In addition, he believes these benefits have led to an improvement in the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, sandals, and handicrafts such as necklaces, earrings, and bracelets.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора- одна из самых активных,пунктуальных и порядочных клиентов Арванда с большим стажем кредитования.Первый кредит она получила в сумме 500 сомони и тогда имела небольшой объём товара.Тогда по наслышке она обратилась в нашу организацию за финансовой поддержкой и рискнула.Получив кредит она закупила партию товара и стала ездить за город на торговлю.В сельской местности нет больших торговых точек и её бизнес стал развиваться  очень хорошо и быстро.За очень короткий период времени она накопила свои ресурсы, но не переставая сотрудничала с нашей компанией.Она считает,что именно наша организация стала причиной процветания её бизнеса.Сейчас она продает мужскую одежду в селах и ездит туда четыре раза в месяц.На очередной  кредит хочет закупить партию весенней одежды.
texts.en:
Gulnora is one of the most active, punctual, and honest customers of MDO Arvand, LLC with a long history of taking loans. She took her first loan of 500 somoni when her business was still very small. She found Arvand through word of mouth, requested financial support, and then took a chance. Using her loan, Gulnora purchased a new lot of merchandise and began traveling outside the city to sell it. There are no large shopping centres in the countryside, and so Gulnora's business rapidly flourished. In a very short time, she greatly increased her financial resources, all the while working with Arvand. Gulnora believes that MDO Arvand, LLC was the reason for the success of her business.

Currently, Gulnora sells men's clothing in the countryside, where she travels four times per month. She would like to use this loan to purchase a new lot of spring clothing.

loans.use: to buy a new lot of spring menswear

loans.name: Karla Janina

texts.es: Karla tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera  y vive con sus padres y sus dos hijos en un barrio de la ciudad de Olanchito, Yoro. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años, alquila un  local que gracias a la Institución ha podido lograr. Esta solicitando el tercer préstamo que es por 20,000.00 Lempiras, con el cual espera aumentar su inventario y sus ingresos ya que va comprar fardos de ropa usada de temporada para surtir. Ya tiene buena clientela y está ubicado en lugar estratégico de venta. En un futuro le gustaría construir su propio local y que su negocio crezca y que le genere buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Karla, age 32, is a single mother.  She lives with her parents and her two children in a neighborhood in the city of Olanchito.

She has been selling used clothes for three years.  She rents a place, and has been able to manage that thanks to the institution.

She is requesting her third loan for 20,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to increase her inventory and her income.  She will buy seasonal used clothes in bulk in order to stock up.  She already has good clientele, and she is located in a strategic spot for sales.

In the future she would like to build her own place, have her business grow, and have the business generate good income for her.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes in bulk in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Yaneriz Melizza

texts.es:
Yaneriz tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Macuelizo Santa Bárbara, junto con sus dos hijas y su esposo.
En busca de obtener ingresos que cubran los gastos del hogar, hace 7 meses ella inicio con una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como ser: azúcar, arroz, manteca, verduras, refrescos, carnes, cereales y otros. Y ella quiere mantenerlo surtido para atender bien a los clientes por lo que ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a ODEF de 21,000.00 Lempiras, con este préstamo va comprar carnes como: embutidos, pescado, pollo, y otros ya que en la comunidad no hay muchos negocios que vendan carnes. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y en el futuro desea construir un local especifico para la pulpería. Su meta es obtener ingresos que le permitan poderle dar el estudio a sus hijas y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Yaneriz is 30 years old.  She lives in the Macuelizo Santa Bárbara municipality with her two daughters and her husband.

Looking for a way to get income to cover the household expenses, she started a small grocery store seven months ago.  She sells food products like sugar, rice, lard, vegetables, soft drinks, meat, grains, and others.

She wants to keep her business stocked in order to give her customers better service.  Therefore, she has decided to request a loan from ODEF for 21,000 lempiras.  She will use this loan to buy meats like sausages, fish, chicken and others.  She will do this because there are not many businesses that sell meat in her community.

She has the business in her house.  In the future she wants to build a specific place for her grocery store.  Her goal is to get income that will allow her to give her daughters an education and to support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to stock her business with sausages, meat, and fish.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works in the traditional Peruvian art of arpilleria, which combines patchwork and applique techniques to create happy, busy scenes. Traditionally, women have found in this art a way to express their creativity as well as a means of extra income. With this loan, she hopes to stock up on fabric in sufficient quantity to obtain the best price. She would also be able to invite talented neighbors and friends to collaborate with her.

Maria has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is her story:

Maria joined a women's group to learn the textile arts. "At first, we'd create our patchwork wall hangings from old clothes. One day, with the little bit of money we each could contribute, we bought bolts of fabric and spools of yarn and thread. With these materials, we created our first pieces to sell."

"I've been able to create more and more textile art over time. This is wonderfully helpful to all of us — my family as well as the women who work with me. We all have families and we want to get ahead in life. It's great to be able to keep this art form alive. I'm very grateful for your help, and want to send each of you an affectionate greeting and our heartfelt thanks."

loans.use: to purchase fabric in sufficient quantity to get the best price

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
Jose Antonio crafts tooled leather furniture, just as his father and grandfather did. He'd like to expand his workshop to have more space. In addition, he wants to be able to stock up on materials such as seasoned woods and quality leather.

Jose Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Jose Antonio and his family have created carved wood furniture with tooled leather for several generations. "For us, embossing leather is a family tradition. My father inherited it from his father, and handed it down to us. Today, my family and I are proudly preserving the family tradition, incorporating contemporary techniques and designs, always ready to face new challenges. Our creations are totally handmade with love and quality."

"With your support, we can try out new techniques and develop new collections. This will let us grow as artisans and as a family. Thank you."

loans.use: to expand his workshop and stock up on raw materials
